about:
The act of games creation demands a serious amount of hard brain thinking and tinkering, mostly indoors, looking at neon screens between stacks (& stacks) of graph paper and empty ramen cups. This makes games development rather lonely work despite it being the most engaging and interactive of all mediums invented by humankind.

badonkadonk tries to be a casual meetup where creators can be amongst other creators, whilst creating. for when you want feedback from peers about your recent ludum dare, share your latest monster creation, found sound effects, PnP demos or just comparing pathway algorithms, talk shop, play each others' games or just eat bad pub food together. Also, we're curious and want to know who else is out there making stuff.

We're just people who love making games/things/gaems/stuff/gmase!

Even if no one turns up, the organisers (yup, that's us below) should always be present. Except for yog - he guards the house when we're away.

make gaems or die tryin.
beigealert: Visit our Sensory Soundpits at the National Science and Media Museum!
beigealert1: WARNING!! SIR TITUS SALT IS NO MORE!! WE ARE NOW AT THE TURLS GREEN!! SEE YOU <3
beigealert2: WE'LL BE AT FERAL VECTOR 1ST-3RD JUNE!! HOPE TO SEE YOU THERE <3
beigealert3: We are, of course, on hold during Da'Rona and have no idea when we will return.
beigealert4: The year is 2023 and we are back, every month, in the same pub.

devs:
Developers who shared their stuff! Do follow to get updates of their delicious games.

Heather Eyre, FullBoar, Duncan, Tom Forth, Grim Spence, Stuart Cowie, DreamAxisArt, Magicbane, Charlotte Gore, Youman Interactive, Dean Smith, Daniel Glasier

Read Charlotte's "A Six Month Indie Dev Adventure" blog!

Rising Runner on Steam!

VOTE The Wizard's Lair on Greenlight!

Swanky Paint on Steam!

Dr. Bulbaceous on Steam!
dont: WE'RE PRETTY RELAXED & ANYTHING GOES BUT DON'T BE A DOUCHECANOE. NO ONE LIKES A DOUCHECANOE.{hello}
greet:
A chillaxed 2 hour get together in a pub for game creators in the Bradford area to play each others games (finished digital to paper prototypes to fully realised tabletop games), get face-to-face feedback and general tomfoolery.

The format is flexible and anyone can show up as long as they are making (or would like to maek) games.

Every 2nd Wednesday of the Month, 7-9pm at The Turls Green. (see map)

@wetgenes Discord Calendar
